details.title: Counting to start at 8 AM
details.content: The counting in the bypolls for 15 Assembly seats in Karnataka will start shortly. The outcome of the bypoll, which recorded 67. 91 per cent polling, is crucial for BJP, which needs to win at least six seats to remain in majority.

Counting of votes for Karnataka by-elections to take place today. Visuals from a counting centre in Bengaluru. pic.twitter.com/NlqlKdx707

— ANI (@ANI) December 9, 2019

details.title: Counting begins
details.content: It's 8 AM and the crucial counting which will decide the fate of the current Karnataka government begins.

#KarnatakaBypollsWithTNIE #YellapurBypolls
Strong room is being opened in front of election observer Sridhar Jituri, district election officer Harish Kumar K, political party agents and others at MES college in #Sirsi @NewIndianXpress @XpressBengaluru @santwana99 @Amitsen_TNIE pic.twitter.com/PTHDRrpeAx

— Arunkumar Huralimath (@Arunkumar_TNIE) December 9, 2019

details.title: Biggies seek divine intervention
details.content: On bypoll results eve, CM Yediyurappa and JDS patriarch Deve Gowda visited temples. Opposition leader Siddararamaiah was in Badami, his constituency, where he met his constituents attending to their grievances. (Read more)

details.title: BJP leads in Yellapur
details.content:
BJP candidate Shivaram Hebbar leads by over 2000 votes over Congress candidate Bhimanna Naika after first round of counting for Yellapur Assembly.

Shivaram Hebbar 4694

Bhimanna Naik 2430

details.title: BJP ahead in Hospet consituency
details.content: BJP's Hospet constituency candidate Anand Singh takes the lead after the first round.

details.title: Congress, BJP leading in 2 each, JDS in one: EC
details.content: According to official EC trends at 9 AM, Congress and BJP are leading in two seats each while JD(S) has the lead in one constituency.

details.title: Congress leading in Hunsur
details.content:
#Karnataka bypolls results trends: BJP leading in Yellapur, Chikkaballapur constituencies, Congress leading in Shivajinagar and Hunasuru constitiencies and JDS leading in KR Pete, according to official EC trends https://t.co/zKo70qsuMN

— ANI (@ANI) December 9, 2019

#Karnataka bypolls results trends: BJP leading in Yellapur, Chikkaballapur, Vijayanagara&Mahalaxmi Layout constituencies, Congress leading in Shivajinagar&Hunasuru constituencies, JDS leading in KR Pete and Independent candidate SK Bachegowda leading in Hosakote, as per EC trends

— ANI (@ANI) December 9, 2019

details.title: Advantage BJP: Saffron party leads in 10 seats, Congress and JDS in two seats each
details.content: At the end of the second round of counting of votes, the ruling BJP is leading in 10 out of 15 assembly segments that went to polls on December 5. The Congress and the JDS candidates are leading in two constituencies each, while BJP rebel candidate Sharath Bache Gowda is leading in Hosakote.

details.title: Advantage BJP: Saffron party extends lead to 10 seats
details.content: The ruling BJP party is leading in 10 seats while Congress and JDS have the lead in 2 seats each. BJP is confident of winning around 13 seats. (Read more)

details.title: Official EC trends: BJP leads in 10, Cong 2, JDS 2, Independents 1
details.content:
#UPDATE Karnataka bypolls results trends: BJP leading in 10 seats, Congress & JDS leading in 2 seats each, Independent leading in 1 seat, as per EC trends; Counting underway in 15 assembly seats pic.twitter.com/I07Wv0ig0F

— ANI (@ANI) December 9, 2019

details.title: BJP extends lead to 11 seats, JD(S) lead drops to 1
details.content:
BJP is ahead in 11 constituencies. That is comfortably above the 7 they needed to continue to remain in power.

JD(S) is ahead in 1, Congress is ahead in 2 and Independent candidate SK Bachegowda leads in Hosakote constituency.

details.title: BJP wins Yellapur constituency
details.content: Shivaram Hebbar of BJP picks up the first for the saffron party. He trumped nearest rival from Congress Bhimanna Naik by 31406 votes.

details.title: JDS loses lead in 2 seats
details.content: The BJP is now leading in 11 seats after winning the Yellapur constituency. JDS which had earlier taken the lead in Yeshvanthapura and KR Pete has dropped to second in both.

details.title: BJP now leads in KR Pete
details.content:
#BypollResultsWithTNIE It’s a shocker in Mandya. If BJP manages to win KR Pete, it will create history with its entry into the formidable JD(S) bastion @santwana99 @XpressBengaluru @ShivascribeTNIE

— Chetana Belagere (@chetanabelagere) December 9, 2019

details.title: BJP picks up 3 more wins
details.content:
BJP makes inroads into JD(s) bastion Mandya with KC Narayan Gowda’s win in K R Pete with a margin of over 9000 votes.

Sudhakar has won in Chikkaballapur and Gopalaiah wins Mahalakshmi Layout seat.

details.title: Congress candidate HP Manjunath wins from Hunsur constituency
details.content:
#BypollResultsWithTNIE #Congress candidate #HPManjunath wins from #Hunsur constituency defeating veteran politician AH Vishwanath @XpressBengaluru @santwana99 @BJP4Karnataka @INCKarnataka pic.twitter.com/STYClJN6HA

— Chetana Belagere (@chetanabelagere) December 9, 2019

details.title: Congress leader DK Shivakumar accepts defeat
details.content:
Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on #KarnatakaBypolls results: We have to agree with the mandate of the voters of these 15 constituencies. People have accepted the defectors. We have accepted defeat, I don't think we have to be disheartened. pic.twitter.com/UOLwXFASHt

— ANI (@ANI) December 9, 2019

details.title: People have blessed BJP candidates with big margin, will focus on state's development: BSY
details.content:
B S Yediyurappa is a happy man after his partymen win big taking the BJP past the majoriy mark easily.

"People have blessed BJP candidates with big margin. We request opposition Congress and JDS to cooperate with the govt for development of the state. We will focus on state's dev", the Karnataka CM said.

details.title: Arshad Rizwan of Congress wins Shivajinagar seat
details.content: Congress tasted its 2nd win in the bypolls with the party's Arshad Rizwan trumping BJPs' M Sarawana. Rizwan breaks his election jinx after facing defeat in two Lok Sabha polls in the recent years.

details.title: Siddaramaiah, Dinesh Gundu Rao resign from Karnataka Congress leadership
details.content:
Taking moral responsibility, senior Congress leader and former CM Siddaramaiah on Monday resigned as the party's legislative leader in the state.

Karnataka Congress chief Dinesh Gundu Rao too followed the suit and resigned from his post.

The Congress, which held 12 of the 15 seats where by-elections were held on December five, won only two, in a huge setback to the opposition party.

details.title: 50-year-old man celebrating BJP's victory collapses to death
details.content: A 50-year-old follower of Sharath Bache Gowda, who won Hoskote seat, collapsed while dancing to celebrate his favourite leader's victory. Rizwan Baig was dancing along with his friends when he collapsed and fell. Despite repeated efforts, he couldn't be revived. The hospital where he was taken for immediate medical attention declared him dead on arrival.

details.title: 11 of 12 newly-elected MLAs to be made ministers: Yeddyurappa
details.content:
"11 out of the 12 newly-elected MLAs will be inducted as ministers. I had made a promise and I will keep it. No such promise was made to the Ranebennur candidate," said an elated BS Yediyurappa as trends turned favourable to his party. He can now breathe a sigh of relief.

Read full story

details.title: BJP's biggest achievement
details.content: Clinching KR Pete from the JDS perhaps will remain BJP's tallest achievement on Monday as it has now made inroads into Mandya - a seat that has always eluded the saffron party.
